En: Never. (used with a negative verb in the future tense).
sine die( from the Latin 'without day'). E.g. Adjourned indefinitely - without setting any future date of meeting
sheet covering the lower part of the body

passing to another subject without abandoning the previous one.
type of badal in which the second word is alien to the first
type od badal where the second word is not part of the first, but s.t. contained in it
Eloquent, conforming to the rules of rhetoric
by means of it, through it
display by a woman of her charms
hadîth reported by both Imam Bukhari and Imam Muslim in their hadîth collections known as الصَّحِيحانِ
Name of the particle لولا which denotes that an action has been prevented from taking place due to the existence of anoter action or element.
the most inferior kind of dates
Judgement, Ruling, Provision of a rule
repose, rest (2) plam of the hand
morphology (study of the forms of words)
His name has been struck off the registry (in school)
to return (2) to visit a sick person
after the pattern of, similar to, in the manner of
to gargle (2) to be in the throes of death
to expel (from school) (2) to separate, cut off
to spend (time) (2) to judge, act as judge, to decree
Never. (used with a negative verb in the past tense)
Both the gardens brought forth their produce.
never mind, it doen't matter, it is allright, may no harm come to you
it is inevitable, it is certain

Ar: لاَ بَأْسَ، طَهُورٌ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ
En: May no harm come to you and may your indisposition be a mens of cleansing you (from your sins)
there is no need to panic. (there is no reason/case for fear)
here I am! at your service!
had he/it ... Introduces a hypothetical condition
Had it not been ... But for ...
introduced to express a wish which is either impossible or very difficult to achieve
the particle ma in innama (meaning only) so called because it prevents inna from rendering the following noun manssub.
palm fibre, name of the 111th sûrah
Religious practices and beliefs not based on the teaching of Qur'an and the sunnah but invented after the time of the Prophet (saw)
participation og more then one subject (faail) in an action
Eastern wall of the Ka'bah between the door and the Black Stone
file (metal tool with a rough surface)
press (for extracting oil, fruit juice, etc.)
Shouldn't you have waited for me?
it fills the place of the 2 mafuls, i.e., it functions as 2 mafuls.
old man, learned man, respected elder
compact building (2) building built with molten lead
Land where revelation came to Prophet (saw), e.e., Medinah
breathing space, place were one can breath fresh air
to enjoin, make s.t. obligatory (2) gr. Affirmation
noun with al attached to it(literally, a noun which has been decorated with the ornament of al)
to be raise, rise (gr) have primary case-ending dammah or its equivalent seconday ending.
Word that make a verb majzum
Where (The mudaafu ilaihi is a verb or a nominal sentence)
Absent. (gr) Third person (he, she, it, they)
verb in which one, two or 3 letters have been added
verb in its original forms without additional letteers
verb in the active voice but with passive meaning in relation to another form of the same verb.
followed with a madi verb signifies that the action contained in the sentence should have been done. In this case it is a particle that makes you feel sorry.
to feminize, give the feminine ending/form
Word denoting a grammatical tool, Instrument, Function
to add (gr) to add a noun to another to signify the meaning of possession.
to show what is not in the inside, to feign
to use a mansub noun after a pronoun to peculiarize the pronoun
to derive a word from another
literally 'abondoning'. The partile بَلْ signifies abandoning the subject preceding it and proceeding to a different subject.
two or more identical consonants or vowels following each other in close succession. Arabic does not like this phonetic phenomenon and usually drops off indentical speech sound,
a three-letter word with middle letter being vowelless
particle used at the beginning of a sentence to draw attention of the listner/reader to the important statement following it
a word linking the hal to the sahebulhall
person, ie first person, second or third person
to transfer an intrasitive verb into a transitive verb
an element in a sentence which can be dispensed with like hall and naat. Opposed to عُمْدَةٌ which can not be dispensed like fail.
what is determined by counting, weighing, cubic mesure or liner measure
noun ending in an original ya such as an-naady
that from which something is excepted
Followed by a mudaria verb it goads. In this sence it is a particle of encouragement.
call, invocation of God, supplication, prayer
being unveiled, not covering the face (woman)
plam of a hand (including the fingers)
sheet covering the upper part of the body
unripe date when it starts turning red or yellow
carat , karat (unit of measurement of purity of gold)
any number between 3 and 9. It is treated exactly like a number.
name of the 5th sûrah (literally, dining table)
literally, 'what Allah wills' : an expression of surprise
I am happy to meet you
May safety be your companion while you stay and while you travel!
may no harm come to you!
the Time of Ignorance preceeding the advent of islam
term, appointed time, deadline, time of death
untill we meet again! au revoir!
name of the 30th sûrah (literally, the Byzantines)
man of flame Abd al-'Uzzâ uncle of the Prophet . He was so named from his ruddy complexion.
one who has failed (in an examination)
libertine, debauchee (A person given to excessive indulgence in sensual pleasures)

the one who is resting, relaxing
